name: salvageable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is salvageable, it can be saved, especially from a fire or flood or from a ship that has sunk: There is nothing that is salvageable in the building - we have lost everything.
able to be improved from a bad situation and made good again: I believe her career is salvageable. See
salvage
More examplesFewer examplesThe original shop burned down and almost none of the merchandise was salvageable.In a disaster, you save the most salvageable things. The seven buildings at the center of the disaster are beyond repair, but the others may be salvageable.It was a dire situation. But he obviously felt very strongly that the situation was salvageable and did a great job. 80 to 90 percent of teens who break the law are "salvageable," he says, and should be incarcerated only as a very last resort.
